lines: O She who removes the ocean of worldly existence
O One who dwells in the Lotus (Padmalaye)
For the welfare of all beings
Salutations to you, O Mother of the Universe
O Daughter of the Ocean of Milk (Ksheerarnava)
O Bearer of the Three Worlds (Trailokyadharani)
Protect me, who have come to You for refuge
Beloved of the Lord of Lords (Devadevasya)
O Lakṣmī, protect me from poverty and distress
Salutations to you, O Mother of the Three Worlds (Trailokyajanani)
Salutations to You, O Purifier of the Three Worlds (Trailokyapavani)
O Goddess, who is worshipped by Brahma and others
O Giver of joy to the world (Jagadanandadaini)
O Bestower of the Welfare of the World (Jagaddhite)
Salutations to You, O One who resides in the lotus
Salutations to You, O One who is restless (Chapalayi)
Salutations to You, O One who is fickle (Chanchalayi)
Salutations to You, O One who is graceful (Lalitayi)
Salutations to You, O Mother of Pradyumna (Pradyumnajanani)
I have come to You for refuge
O One who is the refuge of the world
Save me, O Great Lakshmi, Save me
Wisdom is not beautiful without You, O Lakshmi
Virtue is not beautiful in a person without You
Character is not beautiful without You, O Lakshmi
Form shines as long as it is adorned with You
Character shines as long as it is adorned with You
Qualities shine as long as it is adorned with You
As long as a person has Your grace
As long as Lakshmi bestows grace upon them
Is the one who adorns with good qualities
She who is the greatest among all Lakshmi
By praising Your qualities and glories
You surpass the beauty of the lotus and of the worlds
No one, even the Rudras, the Sun, or the Moon, can express Your glory
No one can express Your greatness
How can we speak of Your form, qualities, and glory?
Protect my cherished desire firmly and eternally
O Lakshmi, who protects the distressed and the fearful.
Who suffers from the affliction and torment of poverty.
I have come to Your side, O Goddess.
O Lakshmi, being the source of mercy, save me.
Grant me wealth speedily and provide me the riches I need.
Seeing me, O Mother, O Beloved of Hari,
The impoverished one has come to Your presence.
O Lakshmi, grant me wealth immediately.
Grant me beautiful and divine clothing and ornaments.
You are the mother, You are the father, You are the embodiment of wealth.
Save me, Save me, O Great Lakshmi.
Save me, Save me, O Goddess of the Gods.
Save me, Save me, O Mother of the World, save me quickly from poverty.
Salutations to You, O Preserver of the World.
Salutations to You, Salutations to You.
Salutations to You, O Goddess who bestows prosperity and righteousness.
I am drowning in the ocean of poverty.
I am sinking in the underworld (Rasatala).
Holding me up with Your hand, saving me from sinking.
Quickly save me, O Goddess, as You remove me from danger.
O Lakshmi, what can I speak of You? Even with countless words, I am speechless.
I have no other refuge, O Lakshmi, but You.
Truly, truly, O Beloved of Hari.
Hearing these words of Agastya, the beloved of Hari.
Filled with joy, the beloved of Hari spoke.
She spoke sweet words, filled with blessings.
I am always pleased by You, O Goddess.
endowed with happiness and good fortune
which is glorified by Agastya, the sage of Lakshmi
bestower of the fourfold goals (dharma, artha, kāma, and moksha)
of ghosts, spirits, and evil beings
in the fields of mandara trees (a type of tree)
for the purpose of removing all faults
as spoken by Agastya the sage
for the welfare of all beings
with the desire for their benefit
